name: Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana (PMJDY)
description: Financial inclusion program that aims to expand and make affordable access to financial services such as bank accounts, remittances, credit, insurance and pensions.
eligibility: Indian citizens above 10 years of age. One account per household.
benefits: Zero balance savings account
RuPay debit card with ₹1 lakh accident insurance cover
Overdraft facility up to ₹10,000
Direct Benefit Transfer for various government schemes
documents_required: Identity proof (Aadhaar, PAN, Voter ID, etc.)
how_to_apply: Visit nearest bank branch or post office with required documents to open a PMJDY account.

name: Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana (PMJJBY)
description: Life insurance scheme offering coverage for death due to any reason.
eligibility: Any Indian citizen between 18-50 years of age with a bank account.
benefits: Life insurance cover of ₹2 lakh in case of death
Annual premium of only ₹330
how_to_apply: Visit your bank branch or apply online through net banking.

name: Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana (PMSBY)
description: Accident insurance scheme offering coverage for accidental death and disability.
eligibility: Any Indian citizen between 18-70 years of age with a bank account.
benefits: Accidental death coverage of ₹2 lakh
Permanent total disability coverage of ₹2 lakh
Permanent partial disability coverage of ₹1 lakh
Annual premium of only ₹12
how_to_apply: Visit your bank branch or apply online through net banking.

name: Atal Pension Yojana (APY)
description: Pension scheme focused on workers in the unorganized sector, guaranteeing a minimum pension after 60 years of age.
eligibility: Indian citizens between 18-40 years. Must have a savings bank account.
benefits: Fixed pension of ₹1,000 to ₹5,000 per month after age 60
Government contribution of 50% of the subscriber's contribution or ₹1,000 per annum, whichever is lower (for those not income tax payers)
how_to_apply: Visit nearest bank branch or apply online through net banking.
implementing_agency: Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority

name: Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY)
description: Housing scheme that aims to provide affordable housing to the urban and rural poor.
eligibility: Urban: Economically Weaker Section (EWS) with annual income up to ₹3 lakh and Lower Income Group (LIG) with annual income between ₹3-6 lakh. Rural: Households without a pucca house.
benefits: Urban: Credit-linked subsidy of up to ₹2.67 lakh on home loans
Rural: Financial assistance of ₹1.2 lakh to ₹1.3 lakh for constructing houses
how_to_apply: Urban: Apply through banks/housing finance companies. Rural: Apply through Gram Panchayat.
implementing_agency: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs (Urban) / Ministry of Rural Development (Rural)

name: PM Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN)
description: Income support scheme for farmers providing up to ₹6,000 per year in three equal installments.
eligibility: All landholding farmer families with cultivable land, subject to certain exclusions.
benefits: Direct income support of ₹6,000 per year
Amount transferred directly to bank accounts in three installments
how_to_apply: Apply through Common Service Centers (CSCs) or online at the PM-KISAN portal.

name: Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (AB PM-JAY)
description: Health insurance scheme providing coverage of up to ₹5 lakh per family per year for secondary and tertiary care hospitalization.
eligibility: Families identified based on deprivation criteria in the SECC database. Covers around 10.74 crore poor and vulnerable families.
benefits: Health coverage up to ₹5 lakh per family per year
Cashless and paperless treatment at empaneled hospitals
No restriction on family size, age or gender
how_to_apply: Check eligibility on the official website or at Ayushman Bharat Kiosks at empaneled hospitals.

location: Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu

name: Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana (SSY)
description: Small savings scheme for the girl child, providing financial security and ensuring funds for future education and marriage expenses.
eligibility: Parents or legal guardians of girl children below 10 years of age. Maximum of two accounts for two different girl children.
benefits: High interest rate (current rate: 7.6% p.a., compounded annually)
Tax benefits under Section 80C of the Income Tax Act
Partial withdrawal allowed after girl child turns 18
Maturity after 21 years from the date of opening
documents_required: Birth certificate of the girl child
Identity and address proof of the guardian
how_to_apply: Visit nearest post office or authorized banks with required documents.
implementing_agency: Department of Posts, Ministry of Finance

name: Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana (PMMY)
description: Scheme to provide loans up to ₹10 lakh to non-corporate, non-farm small/micro enterprises.
eligibility: Any Indian citizen with a viable business plan for non-farm income generating activities such as manufacturing, processing, trading or service sector.
benefits: Shishu: Loans up to ₹50,000
Kishore: Loans above ₹50,000 and up to ₹5 lakh
Tarun: Loans above ₹5 lakh and up to ₹10 lakh
No collateral required
how_to_apply: Apply through commercial banks, regional rural banks, small finance banks, NBFCs, and MFIs.
implementing_agency: Micro Units Development & Refinance Agency Ltd.

name: Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana (PMUY)
description: Scheme to provide LPG connections to women from Below Poverty Line (BPL) households.
eligibility: Women from BPL households who do not have LPG connection in their name.
benefits: Free LPG connection with financial assistance of ₹1,600
First LPG cylinder and stove
Option for EMI facility for stove and first refill cost
how_to_apply: Apply through nearest LPG distributor or online through the official website.
implementing_agency: Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas

name: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY)
description: Crop insurance scheme providing financial support to farmers in case of crop failure due to natural calamities, pests & diseases.
eligibility: All farmers growing notified crops in notified areas. Mandatory for farmers with KCC loans for notified crops, optional for others.
benefits: Comprehensive risk coverage from pre-sowing to post-harvest losses
Low premium rates: 2% for Kharif, 1.5% for Rabi, 5% for annual commercial/horticultural crops
Full insurance amount for crop losses
how_to_apply: Apply through nearest Common Service Centre, banks, or insurance companies.

name: Prime Minister's Employment Generation Programme (PMEGP)
description: Credit-linked subsidy program to generate employment opportunities through establishment of micro-enterprises in rural and urban areas.
eligibility: Any individual above 18 years of age with at least 8th grade education for projects above ₹10 lakh in manufacturing and above ₹5 lakh in service sector.
benefits: Subsidy of 15-35% for urban areas and 25-35% for rural areas
Maximum project cost of ₹25 lakh for manufacturing sector and ₹10 lakh for service sector
Mandatory EDP training of 2-3 days after sanction of loan
how_to_apply: Apply online through the PMEGP e-portal or at nearest KVIC/KVIB/DIC office.

name: Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana (PMKVY)
description: Skill development initiative to enable youth to take up industry-relevant skill training for better livelihood opportunities.
eligibility: Indian nationals who are school/college dropouts or unemployed.
benefits: Free skill training and certification
Monetary reward on successful completion of training
Recognition of Prior Learning (RPL) certification
how_to_apply: Visit nearest PMKVY training center or apply online through the official website.
implementing_agency: Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship

name: Pradhan Mantri Shram Yogi Maan-dhan (PM-SYM)
description: Voluntary and contributory pension scheme for unorganized sector workers.
eligibility: Unorganized sector workers with monthly income up to ₹15,000 and age between 18-40 years.
benefits: Assured pension of ₹3,000 per month after age 60
Matching contribution by the government
Family pension in case of death of the beneficiary
how_to_apply: Apply through nearest Common Service Centres (CSCs).

name: Stand-Up India Scheme
description: Scheme to facilitate bank loans between ₹10 lakh and ₹1 crore to at least one SC/ST borrower and one woman borrower per bank branch for setting up a greenfield enterprise.
eligibility: SC/ST and women entrepreneurs above 18 years of age.
benefits: Loans between ₹10 lakh and ₹1 crore
Composite loan (term loan + working capital)
Margin money requirement reduced to 15-25%
Refinance window through SIDBI
how_to_apply: Apply online through the Stand-Up India portal or visit any bank branch.

name: Pradhan Mantri Ujala Yojana (PMUY)
description: Scheme to distribute LED bulbs to reduce electricity consumption and promote energy efficiency.
eligibility: All domestic consumers with a metered connection from their respective Electricity Distribution Company.
benefits: LED bulbs at subsidized rates
Reduction in electricity bills
Environmental benefits through energy conservation
how_to_apply: Purchase LED bulbs from designated UJALA distribution kiosks by presenting the required documents.

name: Pradhan Mantri Jan Aushadi Yojana (PMJAY)
description: Scheme to provide quality medicines at affordable prices through dedicated outlets called Pradhan Mantri Bhartiya Janaushadhi Kendras.
eligibility: All citizens can purchase medicines from Jan Aushadhi Kendras.
benefits: Generic medicines at 50-90% less prices compared to branded drugs
Quality assurance through NABL accredited laboratories
how_to_apply: Visit nearest Jan Aushadhi Kendra to purchase medicines.

name: Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA)
description: Employment scheme that provides at least 100 days of guaranteed wage employment in a financial year to rural households.
eligibility: Adult members of rural households willing to do unskilled manual work.
benefits: Legal guarantee of 100 days of employment per household per year
Equal wages for men and women
Unemployment allowance if work not provided within 15 days of application
documents_required: Job card issued by Gram Panchayat
how_to_apply: Register with the Gram Panchayat to get a job card.

name: Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Grameen Kaushalya Yojana (DDU-GKY)
description: Placement-linked skill development program for rural youth.
eligibility: Rural youth from poor families in the age group of 15-35 years.
benefits: Free training with certification
Placement assistance
Post-placement support
Migration support
how_to_apply: Apply through DDU-GKY Project Implementing Agencies or visit nearest skill development center.

name: Vidya Lakshmi Portal
description: A first-of-its-kind portal for students seeking education loans and government scholarships.
eligibility: Students seeking higher education in India or abroad.
benefits: Single window electronic platform for education loans
Access to multiple bank loan schemes
Information about government scholarships
Loan tracking system
how_to_apply: Register on the Vidya Lakshmi Portal and apply for loans/scholarships online.

name: National Rural Livelihood Mission (NRLM)
description: Poverty alleviation program focused on promoting self-employment and organization of rural poor.
eligibility: Rural poor, especially women.
benefits: Formation and strengthening of Self Help Groups (SHGs)
Interest subvention on bank loans
Skill development and livelihood promotion
Financial inclusion
how_to_apply: Join/form a Self Help Group in your village under NRLM.

name: Mahila Shakti Kendra Scheme
description: Scheme to empower rural women through community participation.
eligibility: Rural women.
benefits: Awareness generation regarding various government programs
Capacity building and training
Employment opportunities through skill development
how_to_apply: Visit nearest Mahila Shakti Kendra.
implementing_agency: Ministry of Women and Child Development
